algorithm_technique: Identify nodes with no incoming edges by tracking all destination nodes.
problem_summary_simple: Find the smallest set of starting points to reach every node in a directed acyclic graph.
problem_summary_technical: In a DAG, the minimum set of vertices to reach all nodes are those with an in-degree of zero.
key_insights: The problem boils down to finding nodes with an in-degree of 0.
Any node with an incoming edge can be reached from another node.
Therefore, only nodes with no incoming edges *must* be starting points.
